label: ham
subject: [R] Polar graph of time and tide
body: 58 (return) [ According to Aristotle, the stars were homoousian to each other. ÒThat _Homoousios_ means of one substance in _kind_, hath been shown by Petavius, Curcell¾us, Cudworth, Le Clerc, &c., and to prove it would be _actum agere_.Ó This is the just remark of Dr. Jortin, (vol. ii p. 212,) who examines the Arian controversy with learning, candor, and ingenuity.]
